actions/actions/attack.html.title: attack
actions/actions/attack.html.description: you make an attack with a wepon.subsequent attacks on the same turn take a -5 penalty for every attack after the first.

actions/actions/move.html.title: move
actions/actions/move.html.description: move up to your speed (dexterity) meters

actions/actions/take-cover.html.title: take cover
actions/actions/take-cover.html.description: if there is something to take cover behind you may take cover.when behind cover attacks ageist you form the direction of the cover take a -3 penalty

actions/reactions/block.html.title: block
actions/reactions/block.html.description: you use an item or a body part to block an attack.you must make a td 10 speed (dexterity) testany damage that was going to the targeted body part instead gos to the item or other body part without the targeting penalty

actions/reactions/deflect.html.title: deflect
actions/reactions/deflect.html.description: you attempt to deflect a attack targeting you. you make an attack roll with a weapon you are holding witch has the deflecting property if you roll over the damage of the attack it is deflected and you take none.if you roll over half the damage of the attack it is partially deflected and the attack instead rolls on the random hit location table instead of the previous location. for every deflect after the first in a turn you take a -5 penalty

actions/reactions/dodge.html.title: dodge
actions/reactions/dodge.html.description: roll your dexterity if you beat the damage of the attack you don't get hit

items/crafting/forging/metal-casting-kit.title: metal casting kit
items/crafting/forging/metal-casting-kit.description:
an assortment of tools used to cast metals.a casting kit made form materials found in nature capable of melting and casting soft metals such as copper and tin. charcoal (1sp) (one use) sand cast (2sp) (one use) clay crucible (5sp) (reusable) blow pipe (3sp) (reusable) no one should be selling this survival (wisdom) 8td
6h: 20m active per {amount of wood (1sp)}
{amount of wood (1sp)}/2 yield
requires 1 sand (1sp) requires something to make a mould out of such as a existing item or a wooden model 30m
survival (wisdom) 10td
requires 1 clay (2sp) 1h
craft ceramics 10td with bamboo requires 1 bamboo (1sp)
craft woodwork td8
craft ceramics td8 30m without bamboo
requires 1 wood (1sp)
craft woodwork td 12
craft ceramics td8 3h

skills/base/stunt-(dexterity).html.title: stunt (dexterity)
skills/base/stunt-(dexterity).html.description: do a non strength physical feat

skills/base/survival-(wisdom).html.title: survival (wisdom)
skills/base/survival-(wisdom).html.description: survival skills. usefull for surviving in nature.

talents/shp-increase-(5).html.title: SHP increase (5)
talents/shp-increase-(5).html.description: #repeatable #standalone increase your soft hit-points by one. you may take this talent up to 5 times.

talents/skill-increase-(3-6-9-12-15).htm.title: skill increase (3-6-9-12-15)
talents/skill-increase-(3-6-9-12-15).htm.description: #repeatable #increasing-cost #standalone increase one of your skills by +1 up to a maximum of +5. when increasing a skill that you have already increased in this way, the cost of this trait is +3 points per increase.

talents/trait-increase(5-10-15-20-25).ht.title: trait increase(5-10-15-20-25)
talents/trait-increase(5-10-15-20-25).ht.description: #repeatable #increasing-cost #standalone increase one of your traits by +1 up to a maximum of 5 more then your species starting value. when increasing a trait that you have already increased in this way, the cost of this trait is +5 points per increase.

traits/intelligence.html.title: intelligence
traits/intelligence.html.description: the power of your brains processing

crafting.html.title: crafting
crafting.html.description: wood craft: forge craft: alchemy craft: knitting to craft something you use materials these materials will have a relivent craft skill(s) which can be used to turn them into an item.you can cast items with metal casting kit

damage.html.title: damage
damage.html.description:
there are 4 main types of body parts limbs (eg. legs and arms)
connecting partsextremities (eg. hands and feet)vitals (eg. chest and head)
the locations that without they whould preishcrits (eg. groin, ears and eyes)
stratigicly usefull locations that dont do as much direct damage but give a negative effect the target

hit-location.html.title: hit location
hit-location.html.description:
3d43 head
4 head
5 arm (1d2 L-R)
6 body
7 body
8 body
9 body
10 legs (1d2 L-R)
11 feat (1d2 L-R)
12 hands (1d2 L-R)3 damage resistance. targeting penalty -5. damage* 4. wound value 1/2 attack penalty +0damage* 0.5. targeting penalty -3 .wound value 1/4damage* 0.5. targeting penalty -4 .wound value 1/5

home.html.title: home
home.html.description:
to make a character you use talents
while playing a game you will roll skills which are based off your traits
items can be crafted
oh hay initiative is idempotent
a regular human has 10+fortitude (strength) amount of shp and dhp weapons:
bow
dagger
rapier
sword

initiative.html.title: initiative
initiative.html.description:
when the gm calls for an initiative roll it is to determine turn order this is a speed (dexterity) test initiative is made up of rounds witch everyone will take in the turn ordera turn consists of 3 actions. almost everything you do will be an action, moving, attacking, drawing a new weapon etc.when there are opponents on 2 sides of a creature attacks agenst the creature have a +2 bonus the basic actions are as follows:
attack
take cover
move when you are attacked you may:
deflect
dodge
block

skills.html.title: skills
skills.html.description:
a skill is what you roll when you need todo something, the skills in this game are:power (strength)
fortitude (strength)
awareness (intelligence)
inspect (wisdom)
speed (dexterity)
stunt (dexterity)
hide (dexterity)
diplomacy (charisma)
intimidate (charisma)
disguise (charisma)use weapon: bow use weapon: long-sword use weapon: short-sword use weapon: sling use weapon: fencing use weapon: whip etcthese are up to gm and can be trained in session but topics the person knows egknowledge: global knowledge: monsters knowledge: local(doom river) knowledge: local(mothers nest) knowledge: local(west burrow) craft: forge craft: alchemy craft: knitting

headers.heading: there are primary skills that everyone has, these are the things you roll the most
there are also lesser skills that not everyone has

talents.html.title: talents
talents.html.description:
trait increase(5-10-15-20-25)#repeatable #increasing-cost #standalone increase one of your traits by +1 up to a maximum of 5 more then your species starting value. when increasing a trait that you have already increased in this way, the cost of this trait is +5 points per increase. skill increase (3-6-9-12-15)
#repeatable #increasing-cost #standalone increase one of your skills by +1 up to a maximum of +5. when increasing a skill that you have already increased in this way, the cost of this trait is +3 points per increase. SHP increase (5)
#repeatable #standalone increase your soft hit-points by one. you may take this talent up to 5 times.

traits.html.title: traits
traits.html.description:
wisdom
intelligence
charisma
dexterity
strength

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showFrontmatterTags.description: Show tags defined in the frontmatter of the document at the top of the page.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
